title: Korea University
description: When I was here I worked in a project where I had to develop my own search engine prototype for web pages. I worked with MySQL to store the data, did all the math with C# .NET and the website to show the result in NodeJS with Express.js.

title: Pido Taxi (Chofer)
description: Native Android application for an Uber-like service for Taxi drivers in the city of Colima, I worked as a developer for specific features, I wasn't involved in the design neither or architecture of the application.

title: MagmaLabs
list: MagmaRooms: Native Android application to show meeting rooms schedules, getting a fast feedback of when a room was empty or free. This app is designed to be shown in fixed tablets outside of each meeting room.

Beanstack / Zoobean: In Beanstack I worked as a full stack developer working on a custom administration panel written in AngularJS, with it's backed running on Rails 4 with PostgreSQL as the database. I also maintained database, applying several  optimizations to reduce postgres response time and overall backend optimizations to reduce resources usage and increase responsiveness while site was under heavy load.

title: Cuanto Es?
description:
Native Android application developed in Kotlin, in 2018 I fully rebuilt this application utilizing React Native for a broader public
This is an app that I made to help people in my city to easily get the fare they should pay for a Taxi ride in the city of Colima, it is based on the official information made available by the local government.

title: Progressly
list: Devops: Second in charge of maintaining the project infrastructure, everything is setup on Amazon Web Services. I also made the deployment pipeline and migrated our continuous integration pipeline from Codeship to CircleCI.
Integration/E2E Testing: Rebuilt the continuous integration and continuous deployment pipeline and wrote many end to end tests with Cypress.io framework
Platform Migration: Leader of the migration project where we changed most of our backend code from Rails to Node

ChatOps: Worked in the chatops team were we built a slack bot that was used to perform many tasks on the company, including roles administration, database querying, deployment, testing, among many other things.
Backend: Wrote application code for both our legacy rails app and node project app.
Datastore: Worked with Redis, DynamoDB, and PostgreSQL as data backends.
Serverless: Wrote on-demand functions with serverless framework integrated with Amazon Lambda

title: Embo (formerly AMV)
list: Devops: In charge of the project infrastructure, composed of 3 projects, two of them running on top of Heroku, and everything else is running on Amazon Web Services.
CI/CD: CircleCI integration with automatic deployment to both ElasticBeanstalk and Elastic Container Services simultaneously.
AutoScaling application with Rolling Deployment on Amazon Elastic Beanstalk
On-demand background workers with Amazon Elastic Container Services, automatically launcher with a Serverless scheduled function handling the amount of tasks to be run.
Microservices: Microservice on Elixir/Phoenix to process thousands of records of numeric data
Microservices: Microservice on Node/Koa to crawl scrape, and parse thoudans of html files
